results.title: Delta and United Bet Big on Wealthy Travelers. It’s Paying Off.
results.abstract: Delta Air Lines and United Airlines have accounted for most of the industry’s profits since 2022. Their appeal to wealthy travelers could become a liability if the economy weakens.

multimedia.caption: Delta Air Lines and United Airlines have invested in attracting affluent travelers. Delta has said most of its revenue comes from households earning at least $100,000 a year.
multimedia.copyright: Maansi Srivastava for The New York Times

results.title: Do You Know Where in the World These Books Are Set?
results.abstract: Test your knowledge of European geography, history and travel with this short quiz about modern thrillers and crime novels. You may also discover a new book to read.

results.title: A Hike to Crazy Horse Stirs Patriotism and Doubt
results.abstract: Thousands took part in a biannual hike to a South Dakota mountaintop, where a sculpture of the Lakota chief is in its 77th year of construction.
results.byline: By Will Higginbotham and Vincent Alban

results.title: Can I Take Batteries on a Plane? What to Know Before You Fly.
results.abstract: Is it OK to check your phone’s power bank? Can you charge your tablet in the overhead bin? What about a cordless hair dryer? The rules have changed this year. Here’s what to know.

multimedia.caption: Lithium batteries can cause fires on planes and authorities have placed restrictions on them in checked bags.
Lithium batteries can cause fires on planes and authorities have placed restrictions on them in checked bags.
Lithium batteries can cause fires on planes and authorities have placed restrictions on them in checked bags.

results.title: Iran Lures Transgender Foreigners for Surgery but Forces Operations on Locals
results.abstract: Iran became a pioneer in gender transition operations by forcing procedures on L.G.B.T.Q. Iranians. Desperate for cash, the Islamic republic is hoping to attract trans patients from around the world.
results.byline: By Pranav Baskar and Leily Nikounazar

multimedia.caption: “The situation for trans people is dire,” said Saman Arastu, a transgender Iranian man.
multimedia.copyright: Arash Khamooshi for The New York Times

results.title: Help! We Found a Hidden Camera in the Bathroom of Our Airbnb.
results.abstract: When a couple alerted Airbnb to a spy cam in an outlet extender, they thought the listing would be yanked and they’d get a full refund. Wrong on both counts.

results.title: Napa on the Aegean: A Turkish Wine Region Re-emerges
results.abstract: Urla, a lush district in western Turkey, is bursting with promise, with easy access to beaches, an up-and-coming gastronomy scene and a well-marked vineyard route.
results.byline: By Katie Nadworny and Bradley Secker

multimedia.caption: Visitors enjoying a glass of wine at Urlice.
Visitors enjoying a glass of wine at Urlice.
Visitors enjoying a glass of wine at Urlice.

results.title: Air Traffic Staffing Shortages Disrupt Travel for Second Straight Day
results.abstract: The national air space has long been reeling from a staffing crisis among air traffic controllers, as the F.A.A. grapples with a shortage of about 3,000 controllers.
results.byline: By Karoun Demirjian and Christine Chung

multimedia.caption: An air traffic control tower at O’Hare International Airport in Chicago in 2023. Staffing shortages were expected to delay flights by over 40 minutes at O’Hare.
An air traffic control tower at O’Hare International Airport in Chicago in 2023. Staffing shortages were expected to delay flights by over 40 minutes at O’Hare.
An air traffic control tower at O’Hare International Airport in Chicago in 2023. Staffing shortages were expected to delay flights by over 40 minutes at O’Hare.

results.title: His Off-the-Grid Vacation Was Interrupted by Winning a Nobel Prize
results.abstract: Fred Ramsdell found out about his Nobel Prize nearly 12 hours after it was announced because he was on vacation in the Rockies.

multimedia.caption: Fred Ramsdell, who won a Nobel Prize for research into the immune system, said he liked to keep his phone in airplane mode while on vacation and was not expecting an important call on Monday.
Fred Ramsdell, who won a Nobel Prize for research into the immune system, said he liked to keep his phone in airplane mode while on vacation and was not expecting an important call on Monday.

results.title: Taiwan’s Underrated East Coast Is a Gem for Nature Lovers
results.abstract: The island’s lesser-known rugged side delivers staggering natural scenery and a range of outdoor experiences.
results.byline: By Christine Chung and Chang W. Lee
geo_facet: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas

multimedia.caption: Yushan National Park in Taiwan boasts sensational views of waterfalls and river valleys.
Yushan National Park in Taiwan boasts sensational views of waterfalls and river valleys.
Yushan National Park in Taiwan boasts sensational views of waterfalls and river valleys.

results.title: ‘Unfortunately, Your Hotel Has Gone Out of Business.’
results.abstract: A travel reporter investigated a hotel chain that had filed for bankruptcy — and when the guests showed up, he was the one who told them there was no room at this inn.

multimedia.caption: The Tuscany, a hotel in Midtown Manhattan, closed without anyone informing guests who had booked reservations.
The Tuscany, a hotel in Midtown Manhattan, closed without anyone informing guests who had booked reservations.

results.title: 6 Tree Houses You Can Rent for Glamour With a Rustic Vibe
results.abstract: From Botswana to Sweden and from Tennessee to Italy, these accommodations make the dream of sylvan slumber come true.

multimedia.caption: The Nayara Bocas del Toro resort in Panama offers one-bedroom tree houses with living rooms overlooking 80 acres of mangrove forests.
The Nayara Bocas del Toro resort in Panama offers one-bedroom tree houses with living rooms overlooking 80 acres of mangrove forests.

results.title: Drawn by a Vast Rocky Landscape on Ireland’s West Coast
results.abstract: Though it looks forbidding, the Burren, where you can walk for hours among the rocks and valleys with only your thoughts for company, can be fertile ground for creativity.
results.byline: By Warren Berger and Karen Cox

multimedia.caption: Mullaghmore, derived from the Irish for “Great Summit,” is a distinctive feature of the Burren, which is known for its limestone.
Mullaghmore, derived from the Irish for “Great Summit,” is a distinctive feature of the Burren, which is known for its limestone.

results.title: Not All National Parks Remain Open in the Shutdown. Here’s What to Know.
results.abstract: Some underground attractions are closed, and many outdoor sites have reduced their services.

multimedia.caption: Grand Canyon National Park will remain open to the public during the shutdown.

results.title: Discount Airlines Changed Flying. Now They’re in Trouble.
results.abstract: Carriers like Spirit and Frontier have lost customers to bigger competitors and seen their costs balloon. Some are in financial distress.

multimedia.caption: Spirit Airlines helped to popularize the approach of charging fees for services that had once been considered part of the cost of a ticket, like checking bags.
Spirit Airlines helped to popularize the approach of charging fees for services that had once been considered part of the cost of a ticket, like checking bags.

results.title: What’s Your Dream Senior Living Community? Take the Quiz.
results.abstract: Whether you have Jimmy Buffett on your mind or the urge to take a class or two, we’ve got a community for you.

results.title: Margs, Stars and Classic Cars: Surprising Retirement Communities
results.abstract: Those looking for a retirement plan oriented to their passions can seek out living arrangements that are increasingly catering to niche interests.
results.byline: By Sarah Bahr and David Plunkert

results.title: Norovirus Outbreak Sickens Nearly 100 on Royal Caribbean Cruise
results.abstract: Four crew members and 94 passengers came down with norovirus while sailing from San Diego to Miami.

multimedia.caption: The Royal Caribbean ship, Serenade of the Seas, departed from San Diego on Sept. 19. The first reports of illness were made on Sept. 28.
multimedia.copyright: Jeffrey Greenberg/Universal Images Group, via Getty Images

results.title: Two Planes Collide on LaGuardia Airport Taxiway
results.abstract: A plane that was preparing to take off struck a plane that had landed, the authorities said. One flight attendant was injured, and the F.A.A. was investigating.
results.byline: By Francesca Regalado and Mark Walker
org_facet: Port Authority of New York and New Jersey

multimedia.caption: Delta Air Lines planes at LaGuardia Airport in New York in 2023.
Delta Air Lines planes at LaGuardia Airport in New York in 2023.

results.title: Surfing, Not Shots: Bachelor and Bachelorette Parties Go Outdoors
results.abstract: More brides and grooms are trading the traditional carousing and overindulgence for adventure and wellness getaways with loved ones.

results.title: What’s Wrong With Las Vegas?
results.abstract: As prices skyrocket and international travel declines, the city finds itself caught in a perfect storm.
results.byline: By Claire Fahy and Tag Christof

multimedia.caption: Mark Rumpler, an Elvis impersonator for almost two decades, greets visitors at Las Vegas’s iconic welcome sign.

results.title: In the Hills, Across the Moors, Along the Coast: 5 Fall Rail Trips in Europe
results.abstract: Grape harvests, colorful foliage and local festivities make autumn a great time to take a scenic train or tram excursion.

multimedia.caption: In England, trips on the Keighley & Worth Valley Railway have the look and feel of train travel at the turn of the last century.
In England, trips on the Keighley & Worth Valley Railway have the look and feel of train travel at the turn of the last century.

results.title: Tasting a New Flavor of Portugal, in New England
results.abstract: Travelers who fell in love with the Iberian country can revisit it in towns along the coast of Massachusetts and Rhode Island, where chefs and other purveyors are putting new twists on tradition.

multimedia.caption: At O Dinis, in East Providence, R.I., tradition meets the local catch. Classic Portuguese recipes are thoughtfully adapted with a focus on locally sourced fish and ingredients, and include grilled grouper, shrimp sautéed with garlic, clams in Spanish-style sauce, and more.

results.title: A Low-Cost Icelandic Airline Suddenly Folds, Stranding Passengers
results.abstract: Play Airlines said it was ceasing operations, becoming the second low-cost airline in Iceland to collapse in the last six years.

multimedia.caption: Play Airlines was founded in 2021.
